title: OneWater sets IPO terms to raise up to $63.2 million
text: OneWater Marine ONEW, +0.00% set terms of its initial public offering, in which the recreational boat retailer could raise up to $63.2 million. The company said it was offering 3.16 million Class A shares in the IPO, which is expected to price between $18 and $20 a share. OneWater has applied to have its shares listed on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "ONEW." The lead underwriters are Goldman Sachs, Raymond James, SunTrust Robinson Humphrey and B. Riley FBR. The company said there will be 3.65 million Class A shares outstanding after the IPO. The company recorded net income of $1.1 million on revenue of $602.8 million in 2018, compared with a net loss of $4.3 million on revenue of $391.5 million in 2017. OneWater is looking to go public at a time that the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, -0.28% has lost 13.3% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 SPX, -0.14% has slipped 1.6%.
